turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Public services in Worthing.
turn.1: What public services are available in Worthing?
turn.2: Public services in Worthing Worthing, a seaside town in the English county of West Sussex which has had borough status since 1890, has a wide range of public services funded by national government, West Sussex County Council, Worthing Borough Council and other public-sector bodies.
turn.4: Revenue to fund these services comes principally from Council Tax.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Home Office policing in Worthing is provided by the Worthing district of the West Downs division of Sussex Police.
turn.8: The district is divided into three neighbourhood policing teams—Town, East and West—for operational purposes.
turn.10: The police station is now in Chatsworth Road, but several town-centre sites have been occupied in the past.
turn.11: What were some of the previous locations?
turn.12: The first station was at 7 Ann Street; it moved to number 17 and then, in 1922, to 16 High Street.
